comment: Professor Moore is a great professor! He really cares about his students! His lectures are fun and interesting and he has a lot of lore. The class has about 1-2 tests and you do a group project in the end where you apply what you learned. I would take him anytime! He is cool and I've retained a lot in his class! :)

Dr. Moore is great. Idk many people that could make a 3 hour class as engaging as he did. research methods is a difficult class, you MUST come to class and take notes or you'll be sorry. There was also a group project, which professor Moore tries to stay pretty hands off with-- which is daunting, but necessary for growth and learning.

Brian Moore is a great professor. His class was 3 hours long and lecture-heavy, however, he made the class go by pretty quickly with his jokes and sarcasm. The way he teaches definitely helps lock the information in your brain. The only thing I struggled with was his lack of feedback on assignments.

What a great professor! Humorous, caring, welcoming. Though class was early, he made it worthwhile to attend. Midterm and Final, but he prepares you through his entertaining lectures and participation. There is group work for majority of the semester. If you have any trouble, TALK TO HIM! Would definitely take him again if he taught another course!

LOVE Dr. Moore (Brian).  I wish I could've taken more from him! He's amazing and will help you succeed if you want it.  2 easy group presentations, 4 quizzes, final, midterm, paper. I enjoyed going to class each day and loved what we learned.  I wish I did research methods with him.
Professor Moore is great!! He is honest, open, and wants you to Pass. I definitely recommend him for research methods. He makes it super easy to understand.

Very charismatic and keeps you interested. Also, very fair when grading and if you pay attention in class and participate you will do fine. He provides numerous amount of office hours if you are confused. He will teach you to become more professional and become a better writer for the long run. One of the best professor's I have had.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Professor Moore is nice and enjoys lecturing and speaking with students. However, he almost refuses to explain difficult concepts in a way that's easier to understand if you ask. A lot of people in my class would feel dumb when asking because he would basically restate what he already said, which made learning the material difficult. Class was okay

Dr. Moore made this course bearable! He's a great lecturer and is very knowledgeable in what he's teaching. Bonus point for his humor! Also, he facilitates conversations throughout lecture, so take advantage of it and ask questions! If you pay attention in class and do your best work on the assignments (ask for his review first), you'll be fine!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Moore is a great professor that will truly teach you how to do research! He always gives lectures, so you have the opportunity to ask all the questions you need. He genuinely cares about students and provides great feedback. Also, if you take his class, you have the chance to learn about specific topics in research like military trauma!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Do not take this class if you are not naturally gifted in research! He was unclear about his expectations with his group project, & is not helpful when asked to explain things you are confused about a different way. His quizzes were few & far between, covered at least a month of lectures (there are 3 a week), & were all under 10 questions.

Great sense of humor! Brian changed my life with his theory of Penguin memory. If you dont know, ask him. Your understanding of college and life will change. He is knowledgeable about PTSD in the military, and is very involved in research. His insights into these subjects is very helpful.
